image.altText: Exteriors of a public hospital.

props.synopsis: The 66-year-old was found guilty of one count of indecent assault of a child, which occurred in 1989.

title.children: Suspended sentence for former Launceston nurse who indecently assaulted child

image.altText: smelter factory external shots

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Liberty Bell Bay smelter is among several companies owned by the financially troubled GFG Alliance being taken to court by Australia's corporate regulator for failing to lodge annual reports.

title.children: Corporate regulator ASIC takes Liberty Bell Bay to court

image.altText: Aerial shot of ship being towed out of port.

props.synopsis: Spirit of Tasmania IV has departed Scotland and is bound for Hobart, with its expected arrival announced as "late-August".

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV begins 27,000 km voyage to Hobart

image.altText: Building with thick white steam coming out

props.synopsis: Australia's only paper mill uses coal-fired boilers, which its new owner wants to convert to electric, but he says he has been told there is not enough local power in the Tasmanian grid to support this.

title.children: Paper mill owner told not enough power for coal to electric conversion

image.altText: a row of voting ballot boxes

props.synopsis: Can I vote online? What electorate do I live in? What is Hare-Clark? All your questions about voting early in the Tasmanian state election answered.

title.children: Early voting in the Tasmanian state election explained

image.altText: Valdas Bieliauskas was stuck in the water for 22 hours

props.synopsis: When a white-water rafter fell into the Franklin River, it triggered an extraordinary rescue mission that pushed everyone to the brink.

title.children: Inside the moment rescuers knew they had to harm a dying man to save him

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera in front of a display screen.

props.synopsis: The horrible childhood experience of watching a friend taken by floodwaters in Fiji has driven Abrar Shabren to learn how floods behave. Now, in his job with Tasmania's Bureau of Meteorology, he shares his knowledge to help keep people safe.

title.children: How a Fiji childhood horror led to studying weather in Australia

image.altText: Dean Winter speaks at a lectern while Josh Willie stands beside him holding a document titled A Fresh Start Budget Repair

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Chamber of Commerce and Industry backs the state Labor Party's budget savings plan, as the Liberals launch their election campaign and announce 250 new beds for the Launceston General Hospital.

title.children: Business lobby backs Labor's savings plan as Liberals launch campaign

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing to the stadium.

title.children: Salmon tax, hunting ban and all the other election promises

image.altText: A man wearing a cap and suspenders over a t-shirt stands in a field of a farm. He has a dejected expression.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's tariffs were designed to punish foreign nations who ran trade deficits with the US. Instead, the policy has put the businesses and industries he's seeking to protect in the crosshairs.

title.children: Americans say Trump's tariffs are causing the US to 'collapse from within'

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaks at the G7 in Canada

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Australia will not set defence expenditure targets, but will rather focus on investing in the defence capability the country needs. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese won't set defence spending targets despite pressure from Trump

Australia bidding against Türkiye to host COP31, Bowen says

image.altText: Various private health fund cards

props.synopsis: As Australians prepare to do their tax returns, some will be considering whether they want to take out private health insurance — if not for accessing the services, to avoid tax penalties in future years. So what should you consider?

title.children: Is private health insurance worth it? What to weigh up at tax time

image.altText: An intricate golden star shape above capital letters that spell out "The Star" advertising a casino.

props.synopsis: Casino operator Star is staring down another major financial threat, despite shareholders approving a $300 million rescue deal last week. The Hong Kong investors poised to buy Star out of Brisbane's Queen's Wharf development have threatened to walk away.

title.children: Renewed financial threat for Star as Brisbane casino deal faces collapse

props.synopsis: A teenager who was bitten by a shark on the NSW far north coast told a lifesaver he managed to kick the shark as he was being dragged from the water.

title.children: Video shows shark metres away as bite victim dragged from water

image.altText: A hand holds up blocks that read 01 July. Stacks of paper sit below

props.synopsis: Minimum wage, parental leave and road fines will increase in changes to laws this new financial year.

title.children: New laws, changes and payments coming into effect this financial year

image.altText: Close-up face shot of a young woman in a car.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering his partner during a camping trip to a remote cabin in 2021 admitted to initially lying to police, first responders and triple-zero call operators about her cause of death.

title.children: Man lied about partner's death after alleged camping murder, court told

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: The economic reform round table set down for August will talk about tax reform but a strategy for the future of artificial intelligence and robots should be part of the conversation.

title.children: Productivity and tax strategy can't ignore the impact of AI and robots

image.altText: An ASX share market digital board listing stocks in green and red lighting alongside the ASX logo

props.synopsis: Local stocks are on the rise, posting a strong session to end the financial year, while the Australian dollar is also gaining ground. Follow live.

title.children: Shares lift, putting ASX 200 on track for 10pc gain this financial year

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX closes 0.3pc higher after a late stumble
Critical mineral exports forecast to treble in two years

image.altText: The Care Squeeze Graphic no text

props.synopsis: Aged care changes due to come in on November 1 will see self-funded retirees and some pensioners expected to pay more, as future residential care and in-home care residents face a new regime.

title.children: Experts share tips for 'Sandwich Generation' as caregiving costs $18k a year

image.altText: smiling bald man holding dog

props.synopsis: Alexander Marinis, from Victoria, has been laid to rest and remembered as an intelligent and talented man. His identity puzzled Queensland detectives for more than a year after his body was found in the Maroochy River.

title.children: Man whose body was found in river identified after 14-month global search

image.altText: people hold american flags in front of a fire truck

props.synopsis: A man who sparked a wildfire in north-western Idaho before fatally shooting two firefighters in a "total ambush" has been found dead at the scene with a gun nearby, authorities say.

title.children: Sole suspect behind Idaho sniper attack found dead after two firefighters killed

image.altText: A woman looks at the myTax website on a computer screen, resting her head on her hand

props.synopsis: Many of us just want to get the business of doing their tax returns over and done with. Here's what you need to know before you start.

title.children: The new financial year starts tomorrow. Here's what that means for your taxes

image.altText: Woman stands in front of crowd with industrial action signs for nurses and midwives

props.synopsis: Negotiations are continuing after a push by the Queensland Nurses and Midwives Union for "nation-leading" wages.

title.children: Qld nurses prepared to ramp up industrial action in push for 'nation-leading' wages

image.altText: A white sandy beach with six four wheel drives park along it with shrubbery, by the ocean.

props.synopsis: Coastal four-wheel driving will soon be limited in WA's Mid West to protect delicate environments and reduce dune erosion.

title.children: Coastal 4WD tracks to be closed at popular WA beaches

image.altText: A group of pickers pick grapes wearing high vis shirts and surrounded by vines.

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Ombudsman finds 92 per cent of labour hire firms audited in key South Australian horticulture regions had not paid workers proper entitlements and some were operating as illegal "phoenix" businesses.

title.children: Worker entitlements abuse rife in SA horticulture, watchdog finds

image.altText: Virgil van Dijk lifts the Premier League trophy

props.synopsis: Optus Sport transfers its broadcast rights to the English Premier League to Nine Entertainment's Stan, ending a nine-year run of its football coverage.

title.children: Optus Sport customers set for discounts after Premier League rights transfer

image.altText: Food writer and content creator Lina Jebeile in her home kitchen with a bowl of mujadara, rice and lentils.

props.synopsis: After more than 10 years of being a food content creator, Lina Jebeile was ready for a career change. She didn't expect to return to her original job as a teacher.

title.children: I made my second big career change and returned to my original job

image.altText: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley National Press Club

props.synopsis: The issue of gender quotas is the one philosophical and cultural mountain that the Liberal Party has never been prepared to climb. Now former PM Malcolm Turnbull and senator Maria Kovacic are the latest Liberal names to weigh in.

title.children: Turnbull and Kovacic are latest to weigh in over gender quotas for the Liberal party

image.altText: Pep Guardiola gives directions to Rodri as a referee watches

props.synopsis: Pep Guardiola believes playing at the Club World Cup has the potential to leave Manchester City players "destroyed" when it comes to the upcoming Premier League season.

title.children: FIFA accused of player welfare 'massacre' as Guardiola blasts Club World Cup

image.altText: A person wearing an orange uniform and vest with SES written on it stands at the front of a boat looking down

props.synopsis: Police are continuing to search for the missing remains of alleged murder victim Julian Story, following an unsuccessful water operation at the weekend. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Search continues for remains of alleged murder victim on Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: Rafael Grossi wearing a dark suit jacket, blue shirt and maroon tie looking to his left in front of a blurred blue UN flag

props.synopsis: The International Atomic Energy Agency's chief raises more doubt about the efficacy of the US bombing of key Iranian nuclear facilities, which Donald Trump maintains were "oblierated".

title.children: Iran could enrich uranium within months, UN nuclear watchdog says

image.altText: Frank hugging Annie, Annie stand on her hind legs hugging Frank, both facing each other. Dogs around them, grass & fence.

props.synopsis: Frank Finger says he has been "overwhelmed" with the outpouring of support from the community since the death of his wife Cathy and dog Annie.

title.children: Muster Dogs icon mourns loss of wife and champion dog two days apart

image.altText: Evin Prison bike

props.synopsis: Accounts from inside Tehran's Evin Prison are as harrowing as they are rare — many of those locked up inside never make it out. Now Iranian officials say 71 people were killed in an Israeli strike there last week.

title.children: Among all Israel's targets in Iran, this one left some 'in disbelief'

image.altText: A photo of a laptop with a hand on the keyboard showing a photo of damage to a drywall.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken with several workers who are urgently calling for an independent complaints mechanism that allows reports to be made anonymously and without fear of reprisal.

title.children: Workers threatened with weapons and 'jumped' inside residential care homes

image.altText: A person in a green dress smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Receiving support from family is vital to improved mental health for LGBTQ+ youth, according to findings from a recent survey conducted by national youth mental health organisation, headspace.

title.children: 'Tell your child you love them': Family support for LGBTQ+ youth
